definition:
Pernicious anemia
(PA) is a disease in which not enough red blood cells
are produced due to a deficiency of vitamin B12. The most common
initial symptom is feeling tired. Other symptoms may include
shortness of breath, pale skin, chest pain, numbness in the hands and
feet, poor balance, a smooth red tongue, poor reflexes, depression and
confusion. Without treatment some of these problems may become
permanent. [from Wikipedia].
